The brand has been around since 1889 and, like Doc Martens, started out as a working man’s product. Superior quality and classic style explain why it’s still around today.  These Carhartt relaxed fit are a serious contender for the best flannel-lined jeans. They boast over 13,000 positive Amazon reviews and come in seven different colors. Consider the all-black flannel-lined option to fight off frostbite with an attitude.  From streetwear to heavy lifting, these jeans for men can do it all, thanks to rugged flex technology and abrasion-resistant denim. As for fit, these jeans sit slightly below the natural waist, and the relaxed style leaves plenty of room in the leg for movement. And for the price, it’s hard to say no.  Material: 85% Cotton, 14% Polyester, 1% Spandex | Sizes available: 28-33” | Colors: 7 Colors | Inseam Length: 30-36” | Care: Machine Wash 2. They aren’t the cheapest on this list, but they definitely aren’t the most expensive, either.  In terms of fit, you can’t go wrong with this pair of vintage dad plaid. These jeans are double stitched for strength.  Material: 100% Heavyweight Cotton | Sizes available: 34-46” | Colors: Stonewashed  | Inseam Length: 28-34” | Care: Machine Wash 3. If this style works for you, it may just become your go-to winter pair, and you can pick one up in each color. For the unbeatable price, it’s doable. Plus, they pick up double duty thanks to a seamless transition from cold weather activities to stylish outings.  Choose from dark and light khaki lined in flannel or dark and light denim lined in fleece. Pair them with a chore jacket to get your work done, then switch out with a cozy knit to hit up happy hour. It’s safe to say these pants make for a pretty straightforward online purchase. Material: 70% Cotton, 20% Polyester | Sizes available: 29-36” | Colors: Dark Denim, Tan | Inseam Length: 30-34” | Care: Machine Wash 4. Best Performance Flannel Jeans: Wrangler Cowboy Cut Regular Fit Jean When you think of jeans, it’s easy to think of Wrangler. This classic brand is yet another brand known for decades of high performance, this brand is also very trendy these days from a fashion perspective. Right now, their Cowboy Cut are another must-have on any best feece lined jeans list. Time and again, reviewers have noted the easy fit and reliable endurance.  Need some warm jeans to be the new best friend for your cowboy boot? There’s no doubt that these are the classic jeans to pair with your cowboy boots. They hug in all the right places and never get too baggy. As for composition, 100% cotton is great, but a blend with some spandex stretch or other innovative fabric composition will take your denim the extra mile in terms of movement. Believe it or not, cotton blended with a synthetic fiber like polyester adds tons of durability.  @companiondenim / Instagram Style If you’re riding a motorcycle, chopping wood, or doing construction, then a slim style simply won’t do. Pay attention to how the pants fit in the seat and hug the leg for a broader range of movement. Regular, cowboy cut, and relaxed styles will give you a higher range of motion. Straight leg cuts will sit closer to the body and create one long line from the hip to the ankle.  Fit Like style, fit can depend on your personal preference. But overall, it determines how well the clothes hug or sit away from the body. Does the waist feel like it’s slipping or pinching on your natural waistline? Hint: those aren’t good signs. Overall, most guys prefer a relaxed fit that stands just away from the body but doesn’t bunch, hug, or sag.  FAQ While fleece is warmer than flannel, it may not be ideal for lining a pair of work jeans. There’s nothing like the toasty durability of the best flannel-lined jeans when you’re out in the cold. Hard work is a man’s right, but there’s no need to suffer through below freezing temps in a standard pair of jeans, no matter their thickness. Leave the bulky layers at home and nestle into the built-in warmth provided by jeans lined with natural, breathable flannel. 

Flannel-lined jeans provide the fit and style you know and love from your favorite brands like Carhartt and Wrangler while wrapping your lower regions in the coziness only a good flannel can provide. The best flannel-lined jeans will contain the right amount of stretch, come in the fit you desire, and give you that extra boost of pizazz you can show off with a folded-over cuff.

When it comes to value, fit, style, and thermal vibes, we’ve compiled all of the very best flannel-lined jeans for men. The following nine styles have endured rigorous evaluation to prove they bring the heat, both literally and figuratively, when it comes to the very best flannel-lined jeans.

  3. Flannel-Lined Jeans FAQs

1. Best Overall Flannel Jeans: Carhartt Men’s Relaxed Fit Straight Leg Flannel Lined Jean

There’s a reason why everyone seems to be wearing Carhartt these days. The brand has been around since 1889 and, like Doc Martens, started out as a working man’s product. Superior quality and classic style explain why it’s still around today. 

These Carhartt relaxed fit are a serious contender for the best flannel-lined jeans. They boast over 13,000 positive Amazon reviews and come in seven different colors. Consider the all-black flannel-lined option to fight off frostbite with an attitude. 

From streetwear to heavy lifting, these jeans for men can do it all, thanks to rugged flex technology and abrasion-resistant denim. As for fit, these jeans sit slightly below the natural waist, and the relaxed style leaves plenty of room in the leg for movement. And for the price, it’s hard to say no. 

Material: 85% Cotton, 14% Polyester, 1% Spandex | Sizes available: 28-33” | Colors: 7 Colors | Inseam Length: 30-36” | Care: Machine Wash

2. Best-Fitting Flannel Jeans: L.L. Bean Men’s Double L Jeans Natural Fit Comfort Waist

L.L. Bean is just one of those brands that consistently delivers, no matter what. Hardworking men can’t seem to get enough of their Double L jeans with consistent quality and fit over the years. They aren’t the cheapest on this list, but they definitely aren’t the most expensive, either. 

In terms of fit, you can’t go wrong with this pair of vintage dad plaid. It offers just the right amount of room throughout the leg and provides discreet stretch elastic at the waistband, so the jeans conform to your natural body shape with ease. 

This trim and traditional straight-leg jean will not only keep you warm thanks to the brushed cotton flannel lining, but it also shrinks and fade resistant and pre-washed for softness. Don’t worry about overworking these pants, either. These jeans are double stitched for strength. 

Material: 100% Heavyweight Cotton | Sizes available: 34-46” | Colors: Stonewashed  | Inseam Length: 28-34” | Care: Machine Wash

3. Best Affordable Flannel Jeans: Lee Men’s Fleece + Flannel Lined Relaxed-Fit Straight-Leg Jeans

It doesn’t get more classic than the relaxed fit of Lee’s best fleece-lined jeans. If this style works for you, it may just become your go-to winter pair, and you can pick one up in each color. For the unbeatable price, it’s doable. Plus, they pick up double duty thanks to a seamless transition from cold weather activities to stylish outings. 

Choose from dark and light khaki lined in flannel or dark and light denim lined in fleece. Pair them with a chore jacket to get your work done, then switch out with a cozy knit to hit up happy hour. It’s safe to say these pants make for a pretty straightforward online purchase.

Material: 70% Cotton, 20% Polyester | Sizes available: 29-36” | Colors: Dark Denim, Tan | Inseam Length: 30-34” | Care: Machine Wash

4. Best Performance Flannel Jeans: Wrangler Cowboy Cut Regular Fit Jean

When you think of jeans, it’s easy to think of Wrangler. This classic brand is yet another brand known for decades of high performance, this brand is also very trendy these days from a fashion perspective. Right now, their Cowboy Cut are another must-have on any best feece lined jeans list. Time and again, reviewers have noted the easy fit and reliable endurance. 

Need some warm jeans to be the new best friend for your cowboy boot? There’s no doubt that these are the classic jeans to pair with your cowboy boots. They hug in all the right places and never get too baggy. With 20% longer-lasting denim, you’ll feel like Billy the Kid for years to come.

Material: 100% Cotton | Sizes available: 29-40” | Colors: Stonewash, FS Wash | Inseam Length: 30-38” | Care: Machine Wash

5. Best Straight Fit Flannel Jean: Eddie Bauer Flannel-lined Flex Jeans

Some would argue the best men’s pants deliver functionality and adhere to good fashion sense. Eddie Bauer’s pulled out all the stops for the best flannel-lined flex jeans. These pants are not only warm but can be worn on nicer occasions beyond the workplace.

Several different colors let you choose the appropriate wash for your sense of style. The underlying flannel comes in either a red/black or multi-colored look that can be rolled at the cuff. These jeans are lauded for their two-way stretch and straight fit. Throw on a cozy black turtleneck, and you’re ready for a swankier outing than chopping wood.

Material: 98% Cotton, 2% Spandex Shell, 100% Cotton Lining | Sizes available: 30-40” | Colors: Deep Rinse, Meridian Blue, River Rock | Inseam Length: 32-36” | Care: Machine Wash

6. Best Urban Wear Flannel Jeans: Weatherproof Vintage Regular Fit Fleece Lined Jeans

While these denim pair may seem too rigid, they fit well on this list thanks to the flannel lining and the fact that they are denim. Recommended for urban conditions, the Weatherproof Vintage jeans is beyond durable thanks to three-needle stitching.

If you prefer longer lines and less bulkiness, this may be the ideal choice for you. They don’t need to be paired with chunky knitwear to make them appear slimmer. You can safely pair these pants with your favorite lightweight casual wear while keeping your legs toasty. 

Material: 98% Cotton, 2% Spandex | Sizes available: 30-42” | Colors: Medium Vintage | Care: Machine Wash

7. Best Warming Technology: Dickies Men’s Warming Temp-IQ Denim Carpenter Jean

Leave it to Dickies to create a hardworking pair of jeans that are surprisingly cozy. Even the pop of red at the cuff ups the fashion aspect of these fleece lined jeans. 

100% cotton is all good and well, but sometimes a little spandex and polyester give jeans just the right amount of stretch. The flex fabric is uber comfortable and mobile, making it the ideal working pant.

Though they only come in one color, stonewash indigo, it’s a pretty good option. It’s just light enough to compliment all your winter outerwear perfectly. Did we mention they come with advanced body temperature control to lock in heat on the coldest of days?

Material: 73% Cotton, 26% Polyester, 1% Spandex | Sizes available: 30-44” | Color: Stonewash Indigo | Inseam Length: 30-34” | Care: Machine Wash

8. Best Designer Flannel Jeans: Bonobos Fireside Flannel Lined Jean

Though you might be more inclined to turn to Bonobos for suiting, they do have a surprisingly functional selection lined jeans. These pants come in either blue or dark blue rinse with contour waistband, OKEO-TEX & FSC certified branded paper patch, and zipper tape made of mostly recycled polyester. The dark wash is clearly designed with the working guy in mind. And you don’t even have to change before dinner. 

A pair will set you back a pretty penny, but just remember these pants are built to last. Plus, they probably provide the most attractive silhouette on this list. Let them function as both a fashion piece and a work staple. Suddenly, they seem more than worth their value, don’t they?

Material: 70% Cotton, 28% TENCEL Lyocell, 2% ROICA Elastane | Sizes available: 29-40” | Colors: Blue Rinse, Dark Blue Wash | Inseam Length: 28-34” | Care: Machine Wash

What to look for when searching for the best flannel-lined jeans

Material

Clearly, you want the best flannel-lined jeans to be made of denim and soft flannel. As for composition, 100% cotton is great, but a blend with some spandex stretch or other innovative fabric composition will take your denim the extra mile in terms of movement. Believe it or not, cotton blended with a synthetic fiber like polyester adds tons of durability. 

Style

If you’re riding a motorcycle, chopping wood, or doing construction, then a slim style simply won’t do. Pay attention to how the pants fit in the seat and hug the leg for a broader range of movement. Regular, cowboy cut, and relaxed styles will give you a higher range of motion. Straight leg cuts will sit closer to the body and create one long line from the hip to the ankle. 

Fit

Like style, fit can depend on your personal preference. But overall, it determines how well the clothes hug or sit away from the body. Does the waist feel like it’s slipping or pinching on your natural waistline? Hint: those aren’t good signs. Overall, most guys prefer a relaxed fit that stands just away from the body but doesn’t bunch, hug, or sag. 

FAQ

    • While fleece is warmer than flannel, it may not be ideal for lining a pair of work jeans. Fleece is a synthetic material that traps heat, meaning things can get swampy and overheated inside your jeans unless you’re faced with extremely cold temperatures. Flannel, on the other hand, is a natural fabric that’s warm and breathable, so it can retain heat comfortably.

      • Carhartt and other heritage brands like LL Bean, Wrangler, and Dickies make the best flannel lined jeans without a doubt. Time and again, these labels put forth strong denim in great styles lined with natural cotton fibers for the best warm flannel jeans on the market.

What to look for when searching for the best flannel-lined jeans

Material

Clearly, you want the best flannel-lined jeans to be made of denim and soft flannel. As for composition, 100% cotton is great, but a blend with some spandex stretch or other innovative fabric composition will take your denim the extra mile in terms of movement. Believe it or not, cotton blended with a synthetic fiber like polyester adds tons of durability. 

Style

If you’re riding a motorcycle, chopping wood, or doing construction, then a slim style simply won’t do. Pay attention to how the pants fit in the seat and hug the leg for a broader range of movement. Regular, cowboy cut, and relaxed styles will give you a higher range of motion. Straight leg cuts will sit closer to the body and create one long line from the hip to the ankle. 

Fit

Like style, fit can depend on your personal preference. But overall, it determines how well the clothes hug or sit away from the body. Does the waist feel like it’s slipping or pinching on your natural waistline? Hint: those aren’t good signs. Overall, most guys prefer a relaxed fit that stands just away from the body but doesn’t bunch, hug, or sag. 

FAQ

    • While fleece is warmer than flannel, it may not be ideal for lining a pair of work jeans. Fleece is a synthetic material that traps heat, meaning things can get swampy and overheated inside your jeans unless you’re faced with extremely cold temperatures. Flannel, on the other hand, is a natural fabric that’s warm and breathable, so it can retain heat comfortably.
